text: Bottle, purchased in Japan, 12/14/2013. Clear pour, light golden sheen apparent. Aroma is honeysuckle, rich melon, peach flesh, tropical candy sweetness, with a clean fresh finish. Taste is lightly fruity, not as heavy as the nose suggests, pear and melon, with clean rice mid-palate, anise finish. Silky body, touch of heat lingering on the breath. Lovely, nice and balanced.

Bottled. Pale yellow colour, no head. Aroma is fruity and floral notes with some mild spices and alcohol. Nice resiny notes as well as it warms up a bit. Flavour is quite much the same in a pleasant balance. This one worked rather well in room temperature.
Bottled. A light yellow sake. The aroma is sweet and dominated by rice, and so is the flavor, while the alcohol leaves a burn in the throat. Thanks Storm for sharing.

Bottle 72cl.Clear white color with virtually none head. Aroma is alcohol, some fruity notes ala melon and peach skin. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration, and a dry finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. (130608)

(Bottle 72 cl) Courtesy of Storm. 16% ABV in my version. Clear golden - almost crystal clear. Spicy, vanilla-like aroma. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Accents of fruit and vanilla and a rather alcoholic and warming finish. Nice one. 190408
Pale green tones. Complex fruity and licorice aroma with a hint of alcohol. In the mouth it becomes a star, rich licorice flavours blending with fruit and a hint of almonds. Silky texture. Very good.

Wow, the commercial description is right on.  This has an aroma of fresh cut honeydew melon and minerals, and a more polished alcohol nose.  Refreshing and clean, with well balanced acidity, and a bittersweet finish.
Bottle. A water coloured sake. The aroma and taste is of licorice, much like ouzo. Medium body with a dry finish.
Clear with no head. Sweet fruity aroma with almond notes. Sweet flavor with alcohol and candy and fruity notes. Ends sweet with warming alcohol notes.

72 cl. Bottle [Thanks to Storm] Clear and white color with a glow. Aroma of menthol, pine, flower, alcohol, light spice. Full bodied with an alcoholic texture. Again somewhat alcoholic and wood like dryntess in the finish. Quit nice and the best sake so fare. 
19-04-2008

72 cL bottle. Pours clear and pale white with no head. Light woody and spiced alcohol aroma. Flavour is light liqourice and dry. Ends with a dry liqourice note. Again an ouzo like thing. It will take quite some time for me to learn to appreciate these kind of drinks.
Pours yellow.  Smells of rice and mellon.  Taste is of rice and some peaches.

slightly off clear color,the aroma was mildly sweet and fruity with a decent flowery side coming through.the flavor is sweet and fruity with a mild alcohol taste in the end but not enough to disstract you from the fruity side of this brew.Very nice brew and smooth enough to make it an easy drinker.

Hint of yellow with tall legs. Very fruity in aromas with a mild light sweet rice. Flavors of vanilla, melon, plum and nectarines. Light and nearly oily in feel. Finishes clean and a mild rice and licorice touch.

RBSG Portland 2004.  Virtually colorless. Aroma of flowers, grain, white peach, pumpkin, pear. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, flat carbonation, moderately alcoholic. One of the few attractive and enjoyable sakes Ive tried (though I havent tried too many, especially in the upper tier; the typical aroma/flavor profile in sake doesnt appeal to me much, so Id sooner put $50 into a red wine).  Nice balance and pleasant aroma. Domo arigato to Jordan for letting me sample some of this!

Bottle @ RBSG 04 Grand TastingLight beige color, oily coating. Aroma of bananas, humidity, pears, peach, honey dew melon & lots of anise. The flavor has a light sweetness that is so subtle, almost like +1 or +2 on the meter. The tail is warm but brief & dry, a fantastic Daiginjo.
Mostly clear with a dlight yellow hue. Mildly sweet and acloholic aroma. The flavor is slightly fruity, maybe some melon and apple. One of the better Sakes I have had, and my first Sake rating.
Bottle.  Almost clear yellow appearance.  Sterile aroma, with hints of pencil-eraser and alcohol.  Very smooth, with alcohol and pears making appearances in the flavor.  Good stuff!
UPDATED: JUL 23, 2004 Very pale yellow. Aromas of melon or bananas. Flavors are mellow. Kind of a tingly melon. Chocolate as well. A touch nutty. Warms up as it goes down. Very pleasing.
